summary: This document is an email from whistleblower Chris DiIorio to Judge Oetken and others, forwarding a formal appeal regarding a denied SEC whistleblower claim (covered action 2015-016) related to Knight Capital. DiIorio alleges widespread SEC corruption, obstruction, and facilitation of illegal naked short selling and money laundering through sham shell companies like Parallax Health Sciences, implicating numerous individuals and entities. This document is a series of emails from whistleblower Christopher J. DiIorio, primarily dated May-June 2021, alleging extensive SEC corruption, obstruction, and facilitation of ongoing securities fraud. The complaints focus on market manipulation, illegal naked short selling, money laundering through OTC shell companies (notably involving Barry Honig and associates), and the SEC's failure to properly investigate entities like Riot Blockchain (RIOT), Virtu Financial (VIRT/NITE), and others. The author claims his whistleblower tips led to SEC actions for which he was denied awards.

persons.name: Chris DiIorio
persons.context: Author of the email and formal appeal, alleging SEC corruption and detailing illegal trading and money laundering schemes involving Knight Capital and various shell companies.

persons.name: Judge Oetken
persons.context: Primary recipient of the email, addressed regarding alleged SEC fraud on the SDNY courts.

persons.name: Vikas Arora
persons.context: IRS agent who, along with Nate Sarnacki, flew to Denver in April 2016 to meet with DiIorio regarding his TCR.

persons.name: Nate Sarnacki
persons.context: IRS agent who, along with Vikas Arora, flew to Denver in April 2016 to meet with DiIorio regarding his TCR.

persons.name: Kevin Goodman
persons.context: Referred to as the SEC OCIE BD's Chief Overlord of FINRA, accused of producing a 'bullshit' order handling complaint and overseeing a corrupt system.

persons.name: Paul Arena
persons.context: Named as a defendant in an SEC complaint regarding misleading COVID-19 disclosures; described as involved with multiple money laundering shells.

persons.name: Nathaniel Bradley
persons.context: Named as a defendant alongside Paul Arena in the SEC's Parallax COVID-19 disclosure complaint.

persons.name: Keith Coulston
persons.context: Identified as formerly of Ironridge, a firm described as 'Prolific Bag Men' involved in money laundering shells.

persons.name: Michael Sobeck
persons.context: Described as a 'Prolific Bag Man' formerly of Tangiers, involved in NITE top-traded shells.

persons.name: Christina Avila
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Michael Sobeck in relation to Harbor Gates Capital in Puerto Rico.

persons.name: Richard Rosenblum
persons.context: Identified as controlling The Cobran LLC, involved in OTC shell Innovative Payment Solutions (IPSI).

persons.name: David Stefansky
persons.context: Mentioned as being involved with money laundering shell Aquamed Technologies/Nexgel, controlled with Nachum Stein.

persons.name: Nachum Stein
persons.context: Identified as controlling Aquamed/Nexgel with David Stefansky.

persons.name: Robert Klimov
persons.context: Described as an investor in IPSI and involved in money laundering shell Black Cactus Global Inc.

persons.name: Milton Ault
persons.context: Identified as controlling DPW Holdings, parent of Digital Power Lending, with ties to Michael Wachs and others.

persons.name: Michael Wachs
persons.context: Mentioned as an 'investor' in DPW Holdings, partner of Peizer, and involved with Net Element.

persons.name: David Solomon
persons.context: Referenced as 'David "djdsol" Solomon', current CEO of Goldman Sachs, mentioned in context of Milken obstruction of justice.

persons.name: Ofer Abarbanel
persons.context: Named in an SEC complaint regarding transfers of $102 million into NARL accounts.

persons.name: Nicholas Abbate
persons.role: COO of State Funds/New York Alaska
persons.context: Identified as the COO of State Funds/New York Alaska, a former independent Market Maker at Knight Capital, whose fund received $102 million.

persons.name: Mathis Schultz
persons.context: Founder of Northern Data, previously a private banker, whose company built a data center in Rockdale, Texas, and is a 12% holder of RIOT Blockchain.

persons.name: Chad Everett Harris
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of Whinstone data center construction and sale. Connected to Riot Blockchain (RIOT) investment.

persons.name: Gary Gensler
persons.context: Mentioned in a question about whether he will execute Congress's will to repeal a rule exempting 13F filers.

persons.name: Clayton
persons.context: Referenced regarding a 'grossly corrupt' rule enacted under his tenure.

persons.name: Peirce
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Clayton and Roisman regarding a rule.

persons.name: Roisman
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Clayton and Peirce regarding a rule.

persons.name: Paley
persons.role: Head of SEC Micro Cap Fraud Task Force
persons.context: Addressed with a question about the effectiveness of his task force.

persons.name: Honig
persons.context: Described as a 'Prolific Bag Man' connected to Russian entities, Signature Bank, and the law firm Sichenzia Ross.

persons.name: Gottschall
persons.context: Addressed with a sarcastic question about locating Castle Rock on a map.

persons.name: Christopher J. DiIorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, alleging massive SEC corruption, obstruction of justice, and ongoing securities fraud related to market manipulation and money laundering. Claims to be the source of information for several SEC enforcement actions.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.context: Repeatedly described as a 'prolific Bag Man' involved in multiple alleged money laundering shells, including MGT Capital, Bioptix, and Riot Blockchain (RIOT). Connected to other figures like Stetson, Frost, and Sason.

persons.name: Douglas Cifu
persons.context: Accused of knowingly lying to analysts about Virtu/NITE's equity market making share volumes to conceal illegal naked shorting and money laundering activities related to OTC shells.

persons.name: Joshua Sason
persons.context: Named in SEC actions based on DiIorio's information. Allegedly involved in money laundering shells like NewLead, FreeSeas, and connected to Honig via Millennium Biotech/Inergetics.

persons.name: John M. Fife
persons.context: Charged by the SEC for dealing in penny stocks. Connected to Chicago Venture Partners and alleged involvement with MGT Capital.

persons.name: Justin W. Keener
persons.context: Charged by the SEC (JMJ Financial) for unregistered penny stock dealing, based on DiIorio's information.

persons.name: Mr. Gottschall
persons.context: SEC official criticized for terminating an investigation into Riot Blockchain (RIOT) without, according to DiIorio, conducting a proper investigation or visiting its listed headquarters.

persons.name: Ms. Pasquinelli
persons.context: SEC official addressed in the correspondence regarding whistleblower award denials and SEC inaction.

persons.name: Eric Bustilloe
persons.context: Described as a 'grossly corrupt Piece of Shit' and implicated in the context of Mark B. Fisher's Miami-based entities.

persons.name: David Urban
persons.role: Trump PA Campaign Manager / NITE Board Member
persons.context: Identified as a 'Not So Independent Board Member' of NITE/Virtu and connected to his own alleged money laundering shell, FSD Pharma.

persons.name: Robert Eide
persons.context: Named in FINRA/SEC actions against Aegis. His pension plan is noted as a seller in a SciSparc registration. Connected to the Israeli military via Aegis's investment banking team.

persons.name: Kevin McKenna
persons.context: Named alongside Robert Eide in SEC action for aiding and abetting Aegis's violations.

persons.name: Mark B. Fisher
persons.role: Owner of MBF Clearing and MBF Capital
persons.context: His entities were involved in a fraud 'acquisition' by Riot Blockchain, facilitated by Sichenzia Ross. Question is raised about a Miami connection to SEC Director Eric Bustilloe.

persons.name: Dmitry Akhanov
persons.context: Identified as a Bioptix (pre-RIOT) insider and head of the Russian Federal Energy Agency, raising national security concerns about Russian involvement in RIOT.

persons.name: Brian Colleran
persons.context: Healthcare executive who paid to resolve False Claims Act allegations. Was a large shareholder in Millennium Biotech, which was controlled by Barry Honig.

persons.name: Chad Readler
persons.role: Former DOJ Prosecutor, now Federal Judge
persons.context: Was the prosecutor on the Brian Colleran civil case. Appointed as a federal judge by President Trump.

persons.name: Dan Kamensky
persons.context: Subject of a sentencing by Judge Cote which DiIorio calls a 'gross miscarriage of justice,' alleging Kamensky was set up by Handler/Ressler (Ares Management) for interfering with a deal.

persons.name: Jason Sunstein
persons.role: CFO of multiple OTC shell companies
persons.context: San Diego resident and CFO of several alleged money laundering shells like Viper Networks and Santeon Group, potentially protected by SEC LA officials.

persons.name: Ashraf Rofail
persons.role: CEO of Santeon Group / International Land Alliance
persons.context: CEO of companies involved in alleged Mexican vacation property investment schemes using stock as currency.

connections.description: DiIorio is addressing Judge Oetken as the recipient of his formal appeal and allegations of SEC fraud on the SDNY courts.
DiIorio provided information to IRS CI agents Arora and Sarnacki, who met with him in Denver in April 2016.
DiIorio provided information to IRS CI agents Sarnacki and Arora, who met with him in Denver in April 2016.
Both are named as defendants in the SEC's complaint against Parallax Health Sciences for misleading COVID-19 disclosures.
Described as controlling Aquamed Technologies/Nexgel together.
Wachs is described as an 'investor' in DPW Holdings, which is controlled by Ault.
Abbate was COO of the State Fund that received $102 million transferred by Abarbanel and his fund.
Schultz hired Harris to build the 1Gig+ HPC data center in Rockdale, Texas for Northern Data.
Connected through alleged money laundering shells like Millennium Biotech/Inergetics and NewLead/FreeSeas. Sason's entities showed up as large holders in Honig-controlled Inergetics.
Fife/Iliad was involved in MGT Capital (a Honig shell) just before its registration was revoked by the SEC.

DiIorio alleges the core business of Cifu's Virtu/NITE is illegal naked shorting of OTC shells, which facilitates money laundering for figures like Honig. The SEC is accused of protecting this relationship.
DiIorio directly attacks Gottschall for corruptly terminating the RIOT investigation without a proper review, accusing him of criminal obstruction.
Both were named in SEC/FINRA actions against Aegis Capital Corp for violations related to anti-money laundering rules.
Colleran became a large shareholder in Millennium Biotech, which was controlled by Barry Honig, after entering into a fraudulent purchase agreement with the company.
Akhanov, head of Rusnano USA, was an insider in Bioptix (which became RIOT), indicating Russian investment/interest in the cryptocurrency mining company.

events.title: IRS Agents Meet DiIorio
events.description: IRS CI agents Vikas Arora and Nate Sarnacki flew from Chicago to Denver to meet with Chris DiIorio regarding his TCR.

events.title: SEC Approves Parallax Offering
events.description: The SEC approved a Parallax Health Sciences S-1 registration offering, which DiIorio claims was chock full of information about selling shareholders involved in money laundering.

events.title: SEC Parallax COVID Complaint
events.description: The SEC filed a complaint against Parallax Health Sciences, Paul Arena, and Nathaniel Bradley for misleading COVID-19 disclosures, acknowledging Parallax had no money to support claims.

events.title: Northern Data Sells Texas Data Center
events.description: Northern Data AG completed the sale of its Texas data center subsidiary, Whinstone US, Inc., to Riot Blockchain, Inc.

events.title: DiIorio's Formal Appeal Email
events.description: Chris DiIorio sends an email to Judge Oetken and others forwarding his formal appeal for denied covered action 2015-016, alleging ongoing SEC corruption.

events.title: VIRT Q1 2021 Earnings Call
events.description: Virtu Financial CEO Douglas Cifu states April equity market making volumes were 'a hair under 10 billion shares per day,' which DiIorio alleges is a blatant lie to conceal massive illegal naked shorting volumes.

events.title: SEC Terminates RIOT Investigation
events.description: SEC official Mr. Gottschall sends a letter to Riot Blockchain ending its investigation and recommending no enforcement action. DiIorio claims this was done without a proper investigation, including never visiting RIOT's listed headquarters.

events.title: SEC Charges Joshua Sason et al.
events.description: SEC files charges against Joshua Sason and others in an elaborate microcap stock fraud. DiIorio claims this action was based on his whistleblower information but was not posted as award-eligible.

events.title: SEC Charges John M. Fife
events.description: SEC charges John M. Fife and companies he controls for acting as an unregistered securities dealer in penny stocks. DiIorio claims this was based on his information.

events.title: SEC Charges Justin W. Keener
events.description: SEC charges Justin W. Keener (JMJ Financial) for acting as an unregistered penny stock dealer. DiIorio claims this was based on his information.

events.title: Sale of Whinstone by Northern Data
events.description: Northern Data/Northern Bitcoin sells the Whinstone Texas data center. This entity was connected to Riot Blockchain (RIOT) as an investor/customer.

locations: Castle Rock, Colorado (Listed HQ of Riot Blockchain, which DiIorio claims does not exist at the SEC filing address)
202 6th Street, Suite 401, Castle Rock, CO (RIOT SEC filing address; claimed to be shared with ISP ClearConnect and Pakistani BPO entity IBEX)
7961 Shaffer Parkway Suite 5, Littleton, CO (HQ of Vista Gold : VGZ, another alleged money laundering shell)
Tel Aviv, Israel (Location of SciSparc Ltd, fka Therapix)
Newark, Delaware (Location of Puglisi & Associates, legal firm for various shells)
Miami, Florida (Mentioned in context of Mark B. Fisher's entities and SEC Director Eric Bustilloe)
San Diego, California (Location of alleged shell companies like International Land Alliance and connection to SEC LA office)
DiamondView Tower, San Diego, CA (Virtual office used by International Land Alliance)
keyFacts: Chris DiIorio alleges the SEC is a 'grossly corrupt, criminal organization' actively facilitating massive frauds, including illegal naked short selling and money laundering through sham shell companies like Parallax Health Sciences.
DiIorio filed a TCR (Tip, Complaint, or Referral) with the SEC and IRS regarding Knight Capital, leading to IRS CI agents meeting him in Denver in April 2016.

The SEC's 2020 complaint against Parallax for misleading COVID-19 disclosures is cited as evidence of SEC obstruction, as it omits related entities and AML issues while acknowledging Parallax was a money laundering shell.
Numerous individuals and entities are named as involved in alleged money laundering schemes, including Keith Coulston (Ironridge/Ionic), Michael Sobeck, Richard Rosenblum, and Milton Ault.
The email connects recent events like Riot Blockchain's acquisition of a Texas data center from Northern Data (founded by Mathis Schultz) to the ongoing alleged frauds.

The whistleblower, Christopher J. DiIorio, alleges the SEC is engaged in systematic criminal obstruction and corruption, actively facilitating ongoing securities fraud and money laundering while denying him rightful whistleblower awards.

Riot Blockchain (RIOT) is alleged to be a non-operational 'Honig money laundering shell' that only exists in SEC filings, with its listed Colorado headquarters being shared with an ISP and a Pakistani business process outsourcing company.

Virtu Financial/NITE is accused of being the core engine for illegal naked short selling of OTC 'money laundering shells,' with CEO Douglas Cifu allegedly lying about trading volumes to conceal this activity, all with SEC protection.
Russian government-linked entities, specifically Rusnano USA led by Dmitry Akhanov, are shown to have been investors in Bioptix, the precursor to Riot Blockchain, raising national security concerns.

Multiple SEC enforcement actions (against Joshua Sason, John Fife, Justin Keener) are claimed by DiIorio to be directly based on his whistleblower information, yet were allegedly kept off the award-eligible website to avoid paying him.
